name: flow
description: Flow content is a broad category that encompasses most elements that can go inside the <body> element, including heading elements, sectioning elements, phrasing elements, embedding elements, interactive elements, and form-related elements. It also includes text nodes (but not those that only consist of white space characters)

name: phrasing
description: Phrasing content is any textual content that is not a child of a flow content, or a flow content that is not a child of a phrasing content. This includes text nodes, comments, elements with no children, and elements that are children of a flow content, but not phrasing content.

name: interactive
description: Interactive content is content that requires user input, such as user interface controls, or a <button> element.

name: embedded
description: Embedded content is content that is embedded, or could be embedded, in other content. Examples include applets, frames, iframes, and plug-ins.

name: sectioning
description: Sectioning content is content that is a heading, or a group of headings that are related and are repeated in the same document more than once.

name: heading
description: Heading content is content that is a heading, or a group of headings that are related but are not repeated in the same document.

name: metadata
description: Metadata content is information that is not meant for presentation, such as a <meta> element, a <link> element, a <script> element, or a <style> element.
